content:
ACT
65
Relationship between earlier and later wills
If the earlier will is not expressly revoked by the later will, the provisions of the earlier will remain in force if and to the extent that they do not conflict with the later provisions.
If the testator has revoked a later will, the earlier will regains force, unless it is proven that the testator did not want it. The same applies in the event that he revoked the revocation of the will.
